content.rendered:
This FREE DevOps Guide will help you avoid:

  1. Treating Docker containers as Virtual Machines,
  2. Creating Docker images that are not transparent,
  3. Creating Dockerfiles that have side effects,
  4. Confusing images that are used for development with those used for deployment,
  5. Using different images for each environment,
  6. Creating Docker images on production servers,
  7. Working with git hashes instead of Docker images,
  8. Hardcoding secrets and configuration into container images,
  9. Creating Docker files that do too much,
  10. Creating Docker files that do too little.
